TITLE: Spirit Airlines Raises Outlook, Looks to Refinance Debt Following Blocked JetBlue Deal
SUMMARY: Shares soared as the budget airline guided for a better-than-expected quarter.

TITLE: Should You Use ChatGPT for Medical Advice?
SUMMARY: Yes, patients and doctors can use chatbots for certain types of questions, experts say. But beware of the shortcomings.

TITLE: Ford to Cut Production of Electric F-150 Lightning Amid Weaker Demand
SUMMARY: The truck has been a central part of the automaker’s EV strategy in the past few years, and the plant itself has been in the spotlight—even receiving a visit from President President Biden.

TITLE: We Asked AI to Draft a Business Plan. Here's What We Got.
SUMMARY: Well, let’s just say artificial intelligence wouldn’t be a bad placefor an entrepreneur to start. But it’s hardly ready for prime time.

TITLE: The Multibillion-Dollar Clean Energy Bet Gone Wrong
SUMMARY: Offshore wind turbines are proving too risky for many utilities.

SUMMARY: The tech giant’s proposal is aimed at allaying competition concerns from European regulators.

TITLE: The Latest Ad Boom: Lawyers Seeking Plaintiffs for Mass Litigation
SUMMARY: The ad flood reflects the growth in mass product-liability and personal-injury cases—and investor interest in backing the lawsuits.

TITLE: The Companies Cutting Jobs in 2024: Here's the List
SUMMARY: The layoffs are expected to be smaller and more targeted than those in 2023.

SUMMARY: Being let go used to be a private moment. Now, it’s often fodder for social-media content.

TITLE: The Real Reason You're Paying for So Many Subscriptions
SUMMARY: It’s one of the hidden forces behind the subscription economy: Americans are spending billions on stuff they forget to cancel.

TITLE: The Multibillion-Dollar Bet That Truckers Will Ditch Diesel for Electricity
SUMMARY: Cummins, the leading maker of diesel engines in the U.S., and two truck makers, Daimler and Paccar, are teaming up on a $2 billion factory in Mississippi to make batteries for electric commercial trucks.

TITLE: Wendy's CEO Todd Penegor to Exit, PepsiCo Executive Kirk Tanner Named Successor
SUMMARY: The fast-food chain said Penegor, who has served as CEO since 2016 and joined the company a decade ago, will leave in February.

TITLE: AST SpaceMobile to Offer $100 Million in Stock After AT&T, Google Deal
SUMMARY: Shares jumped after news of the AT&T and Google investments, then reversed course after the company launched the offering.

TITLE: Mesa Air Group Strikes Deal With United Airlines to Improve Liquidity
SUMMARY: The regional air carrier said it has amended its CPA agreement with United to increase its block-hour rate, which should generate about $63.5 million in extra revenue

TITLE: Macy's to Cut 2,350 Jobs, Close Five Stores
SUMMARY: Macy’s plans to lay off about 13% of its corporate staff in a bid to trim costs and redirect spending toward improving customers’ shopping experience.

TITLE: Drugmakers Raise Prices of Ozempic, Mounjaro and Hundreds of Other Drugs
SUMMARY: The list prices of 775 brand-name drugs rose during the first half of January.

TITLE: Peltz Calls for Disney to Target 'Netflix-Like' Streaming Margins
SUMMARY: The activist investor’s Trian Fund Management is also pressing for clear succession planning and studio improvements.

TITLE: Why You Might Want Alexa or Siri to Sound More Like You
SUMMARY: Research suggests that consumers would like and trust the assistant more if it reminds them of themselves

TITLE: Is It Safe to Share Personal Information With a Chatbot?
SUMMARY: Users may find it tempting to reveal health and financial information in conversations with AI chatbots. There are plenty of reasons to be cautious.
